column4: so i am trying to setup a samba share,  using the ip address of the other machine I can connect fine, but when trying to use the computer name its coming back that its unreachable,  is there something else that needs to be done to use the name instead of ip?  i thought it was just //computername  instead of //192.168.xxx.xxx
run the command: host computername
when i do the host command it comes back showing 2 ips for the machine
neither are the IPs are the 192.168.xxx.xxx one i normally use though
well, there's your problem :D
before it gave you the ip, it should give you a dns provider. is that correct?
it didnt give me any dns info, just 2 ips and then timed out
oops, sorry. use: nslookup computername
ok that time it gave me the dns server ip
is that the correct server?
its the ip of my router, not the machine i want to connect to
generally, your router is also your dns server, so that's fine
yea
in which case, you need to convince your router that computername is something else
im not sure what you mean
i mean you need to configure your router
in my routers settings it already shows my other machine listed and it recognizes the machines name correctly
just when i try to connect to that machine using its name from this machine it doesnt respond
then i'm not sure. the problem is most likelywith your router, though
ok well thanks anyway, i guess i'll just use my backup plan and set the ips on each machine to be static so i dont have to even worry about using the machine names
as a hack, you could edit /etc/hosts
